result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles Edward Johnson Jr in court.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Charles Edward Johnson Jr. Kevin Clancy, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Samuel E. Simpson for the State of Wisconsin. Court reinstates signature bond. All previously ordered conditions remain. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report received and filed.  nk

Warrant/Capias/Commitment canceled; Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff.  Original (Copy) bench warrant received.  Case is adjourned for Return of Bench Warrant in Branch 36. Return on Warrant scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($2,500.00 signature bond) LW
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Charles Edward Johnson Jr not in court.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Charles Edward Johnson Jr.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Case set for plea and sentencing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court forfeits bail.

Defendant Charles Edward Johnson Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Charles Edward Johnson Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Charles Edward Johnson not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (10 pages) commencing 05-24-2022 by KATHLEEN S. WORDEN.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Charles Edward Johnson not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and request case set for hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38. **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles Edward Johnson in court with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg; both appear by video.  Defendant Charles Edward Johnson in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 05CF6796. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer O. Stamps III. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Charles Edward Johnson in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Charles Edward Johnson in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles Edward Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
